results.description: Combine enterprise_value and ebitda to identify cheap relative valuations. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using multiple fields (enterprise_value, ebitda). Applied SUGGESTION3: both fields coverage=0.5 so I use ts_backfill(...) to backfill. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION4 applied: picked high userCount/alphaCount fields (enterprise_value, ebitda) for robustness. Confidence: 0.80 because EV/EBITDA is a well-known value signal with good coverage.

Cheapness measured by enterprise_value / revenue. Used multiple fields per SUGGESTION1 (enterprise_value, fnd6_newa2v1300_revt). Both have coverage=0.5 so used ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. No vector usage (SUGGESTION2). Chose enterprise_value (high userCount) per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.75: classic valuation metric but noisier than EBITDA.

Cash generation relative to enterprise value signals quality. Used cashflow_op + enterprise_value (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=0.5 so used ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: cashflow_op and enterprise_value have high userCount. No vector fields. Confidence 0.82: cash yield is robust vs accrual distortions.

results.idea: Accruals proxy: net income vs CFO divergence
results.description: Detect firms with rising accruals by comparing operating cashflow to income_beforeextra. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1 (cashflow_op, income_beforeextra). Both coverage=0.5 so ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION2 not applied. SUGGESTION4: picked widely used fields. Confidence 0.70 â€” accruals signal historically profitable but moderate noise.

High capex relative to sales can signal investment or waste; use capex and revenue (SUGGESTION1). Both have 0.5 coverage so ts_backfill used (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: capex has very high userCount. No vector use. Confidence 0.58 due to heterogeneity across industries.

Signal firms accelerating buybacks using quarterly total shares repurchased. Uses fnd6_newqeventv110_cshopq (SUGGESTION1 single field counted as buyback intensity). Coverage=0.5 so ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: this buyback field has moderate userCount. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence 0.65: repurchase spikes often correlate with returns but can be timing-dependent.

Firms reducing total debt are de-risking; use ts_delta on debt. Used debt (high userCount) and ts_backfill (coverage 0.5) per SUGGESTION3. Only one field so SUGGESTION1 partially applied. No vectors. Confidence 0.6: deleveraging is positive but sometimes occurs with asset sales.

Momentum in return_equity signals improving profitability. Used return_equity (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=0.5 -> ts_backfill used (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 applied since return_equity has high userCount. Confidence 0.72: ROE momentum tends to persist medium-term.

Return on assets momentum (return_assets). Applied ts_backfill due to coverage 0.5. Chose return_assets for high userCount per SUGGESTION4. No vector usage. Confidence 0.68: similar rationale to ROE but asset-based.

Rising bookvalue_ps relative to enterprise_value may signal improving fundamentals. Used two fields (bookvalue_ps, enterprise_value) per SUGGESTION1 and ts_backfill for both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.66: book signals are stable but slow.

Inventory builds relative to historical levels often precede margin pressure. Use inventory and ts_delta. Both coverage=0.5 so ts_backfill used (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: inventory has solid userCount. Confidence 0.55: industry effects stronger here.

Compare receivable growth to revenue growth to flag worsening credit. Applied SUGGESTION1 with receivable and fnd6_newa2v1300_revt. Both use ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). No vector fields. SUGGESTION4: chose fields with good usage. Confidence 0.60: predictive in some sectors.

Declining sga_expense / revenue ratio signals operational leverage. Uses sga_expense and revenue per SUGGESTION1. Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: both fields have high userCounts. Confidence 0.64: often persistent but seasonality matters.

results.idea: CapEx reduction + rising CFO (free cashflow improvement)
results.description: Combine falling capex and rising operating cashflow: used capex and cashflow_op (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfill both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: capex and cashflow_op have high user counts. Confidence 0.6: capex cuts can be beneficial if not growth-killing.

EBIT relative to revenue increasing signals margin expansion. Uses ebit and revenue (SUGGESTION1), ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: ebit has high userCount. Confidence 0.7: margins drive returns.

Momentum in ebitda via ts_delta. Single-field signal; used ts_backfill since coverage=0.5. SUGGESTION4 applied (ebitda high userCount). SUGGESTION2 not relevant. Confidence 0.75: EBITDA momentum is robust medium-term.

results.idea: Enterprise value to invested capital reversion (EV / invested_capital)
results.description: Relative valuation vs invested capital may identify capital-light outperformers. Used enterprise_value and invested_capital (SUGGESTION1). Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: invested_capital has reasonable support. Confidence 0.6: niche but complementary.

Rising pretax_income indicates improving profitability. Single-field momentum with ts_backfill applied (coverage 0.5). SUGGESTION4: pretax_income has high userCount. Confidence 0.68: earnings momentum is predictive but noisy.

Increase in working capital (cash-generative release) can boost free cashflow. Used working_capital and ts_backfill (coverage 0.5). SUGGESTION4: working_capital widely used. Confidence 0.59: depends on seasonality and business model.

results.idea: Inventory turnover improvement proxy (sales_growth vs inventory)
results.description: Compare sales_growth and inventory delta to spot improving turnover. Applied SUGGESTION1 with sales_growth and inventory and ts_backfill for both (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.56: useful in retail/manufacturing.

Higher in-process R&D investment relative to revenue may forecast future growth. Used fnd6_newqv1300_rdipq and revenue (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: r&d fields moderate userCount. Confidence 0.47: long horizon and sector dependent.

Dividend cashflow relative to EV to find reliable income names. Used cashflow_dividends and enterprise_value (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: cashflow_dividends has high userCount. Confidence 0.62: income-focused, moderate risk.

results.idea: Operating leverage signal: revenues up, costs stable (sales_growth vs caxts)
results.description: Compare sales_growth and total costs (caxts) to detect operating leverage. Used both fields (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: sales_growth strong userCount. Confidence 0.57: depends on margin structure.

Rising fnd6_ch (cash) signals balance-sheet strengthening. Single-field with ts_backfill (coverage 0.5). SUGGESTION4: cash has reasonable usage. Confidence 0.63: cash accumulation often precedes buybacks or M&A.

Higher (cashflow_op - capex) indicates better cash conversion. Used two fields (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfill for both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.71: FCF improvement is often rewarded.

results.idea: Leverage vs EBITDA declining (Debt / EBITDA fall)
results.description: Falling debt/ebitda suggests lower risk and optionality. Used debt and ebitda (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 used both popular fields. Confidence 0.66: sensible credit-quality signal.

results.idea: Earnings quality: EBITDA vs net income divergence
results.description: Assess earnings quality by comparing ebitda momentum to income_beforeextra. Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3) per SUGGESTION1. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.6: helpful but depends on accounting choices.

results.idea: Market reaction to prior buybacks (post-buyback momentum)
results.description: Identify short-term momentum after large repurchases using fnd6_newqeventv110_cshopq and enterprise_value. Both ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.61: buyback announcement/implementation often helps returns short-term.

Use invested_capital and ebit to proxy ROIC improvement. Applied SUGGESTION1 and ts_backfill for both per SUGGESTION3. SUGGESTION4 selected invested_capital. Confidence 0.69: ROIC momentum is meaningful.

Use cptnewqv1300_epsf12 (12m EPS) momentum. Field present as fnd6_cptnewqv1300_epsf12; ts_backfill used for coverage (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: EPS12 is commonly used. Confidence 0.7: EPS momentum predictive medium-term.
Rising ebitda relative to revenue signals margin expansion. Used ebitda and revenue (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 used ebitda high userCount. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Short-term sales surprise proxy (quarterly sales jump)
results.description: Sales/Turnover (fnd6_cptnewqv1300_saleq) quarter-over-quarter jump. ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION4: sales field has good userCount. Confidence 0.62: direct sales momentum often precedes returns.

results.idea: Rising cashflow from operations per share (CFO / shares)

results.description: Compare work-in-process inventory (invwip) and finished goods (invfgq). Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). Used two fields per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.50: niche manufacturing signal.
